translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: When We asked the angels to bow before Adam, they all bowed but Iblis, who said: "Can I bow before him whom You created from clay?"

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: And recall when We ordered the angels that, “Prostrate before Adam” – so they all prostrated except Iblis; he said, “Shall I prostrate before one whom You have created from clay?”

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: And when We said to the angels, 'Bow yourselves to Adam'; so they bowed themselves, save Iblis; he said,, 'Shall I bow myself unto one Thou hast created of clay?'

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: And recall what time We said unto the angels: prostrate youselves before Adam. So they prostrated themselves, but Iblis did not; he said: shall I prostrate myself before one whom Thou hast created of clay?

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: And (remember) when We said to the angels: "Prostrate unto Adam." They prostrated except Iblis (Satan). He said: "Shall I prostrate to one whom You created from clay?"

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: When We said to the angels, “Bow down before Adam,” they bowed down, except for Satan. He said, “Shall I bow down before someone You created from mud?”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: And recall when We asked the angels to prostrate themselves before Adam; all prostrated themselves except Iblis, who said: "Shall I prostrate myself before him whom You created of clay?"

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: And (remember) when We said to the angels: "Prostrate yourselves unto Adam." They prostrated themselves except Iblis. He said: "Shall I prostrate myself to one whom You created from clay"

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: And when We said unto the angels: Fall down prostrate before Adam and they fell prostrate all save Iblis, he said: Shall I fall prostrate before that which Thou hast created of clay?

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: When We said to the angels, ‘Prostrate before Adam,’ they [all] prostrated, but not Iblis: he said, ‘Shall I prostrate before someone whom You have created from clay?’

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: When We said to the angels: 'Prostrate yourselves before Adam' they all prostrated themselves, except iblis (father of the jinn), who said: 'Shall I prostrate to him whom You have created from clay?

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And [mention] when We said to the angles, "Prostrate to Adam," and they prostrated, except for Iblees. He said, "Should I prostrate to one You created from clay?"

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: When We told the angels to prostrate before Adam, they all obeyed, except Iblis who said, "Should I prostrate before one whom You have created out of clay?"

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: And when We said to the angels: Make obeisance to Adam; they made obeisance, but Iblis (did it not). He said: Shall I make obeisance to him whom Thou hast created of dust?

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: When We said to the angels, "Prostrate yourselves before Adam," they all prostrated themselves except Iblis. He said, "Am I to prostrate myself to someone You have created out of clay?"

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: Behold! We said to the angels: "Bow down unto Adam": They bowed down except Iblis: He said, "Shall I bow down to one whom Thou didst create from clay?"

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: Indeed We have honoured the children of Adam, and carried them over land and sea, provided them with good things for their sustenance, and exalted them over many of Our creatures.

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: Indeed We have honoured the Descendants of Adam and transported them over land and sea, and gave them good things as sustenance, and made them better than most of Our creation.

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: We have honoured the Children of Adam and carried them on land and sea, and provided them with good things, and preferred them greatly over many of those We created.

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: And assuredly We have honoured the Children of Adam: and We have borne them on the land and the sea, and We have provided them with clean things, and We have preferred them over many of them whom We have created with a preferment.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: And indeed We have honoured the Children of Adam, and We have carried them on land and sea, and have provided them with At-Taiyibat (lawful good things), and have preferred them above many of those whom We have created with a marked preference.

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: We have honored the Children of Adam, and carried them on land and sea, and provided them with good things, and greatly favored them over many of those We created.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Indeed, We honoured the progeny of Adam, and bore them across land and sea and provided them with good things for their sustenance, and exalted them above many of Our creatures.

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: And indeed We have honored the Children of Adam, and We have carried them on land and sea, and have provided them with At-Tayyibat, and have preferred them above many of those whom We have created with a marked preferment.

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: Verily we have honoured the Children of Adam. We carry them on the land and the sea, and have made provision of good things for them, and have preferred them above many of those whom We created with a marked preferment.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: Certainly We have honoured the Children of Adam, and carried them over land and sea, and provided them with all the good things, and preferred them with a complete preference over many of those We have created.

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: We have honored the children of Adam and carried them on both land and sea. We have provided them with good things and greatly preferred them above much of Our creation.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And We have certainly honored the children of Adam and carried them on the land and sea and provided for them of the good things and preferred them over much of what We have created, with [definite] preference.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: We have honored the children of Adam, carried them on the land and the sea, given them pure sustenance and exalted them above most of My creatures.

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: And surely We have honored the children of Adam, and We carry them in the land and the sea, and We have given them of the good things, and We have made them to excel by an appropriate excellence over most of those whom We have created.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: We have honoured the children of Adam, and have borne them on the land and the sea, given them for sustenance things which are good and pure; and exalted them above many of Our creatures.

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: We have honoured the sons of Adam; provided them with transport on land and sea; given them for sustenance things good and pure; and conferred on them special favours, above a great part of our creation.

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: When We said to the angels: "Bow before Adam in adoration," they all bowed but Iblis. He was one of the jinni and rebelled against his Lord's command. And yet you take him and his offspring as your friends instead of Me, even though they are your enemies. How sad a substitute for the evil-doers!

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: And recall when We commanded the angels that, “Prostrate before Adam” – so they all prostrated, except Iblis; he was of the jinn, he therefore rebelled against his Lord’s command; “What! You choose him and his offspring as your friends instead of Me, whereas they are your enemies?” And what an evil alternative did the unjust get.

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: And when We said to the angels, 'Bow yourselves to Adam'; so they bowed themselves, save Iblis; he was one of the jinn, and committed ungodliness against his Lord's command. What, and do you take him and his seed to be your friends, apart from Me, and they an enemy to you? How evil is that exchange for the evildoers!

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: And recall what time we said unto the angels: prostrate yourselves before Adam, and they prostrated themselves, but Iblis did not; he was of the genii; so he trespassed the commandment of his Lord. Would ye then take him and his progeny as patrons instead of Me, whereas they are unto you an enemy III is for the wrong-doers an exchange!

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: And (remember) when We said to the angels; "Prostrate to Adam." So they prostrated except Iblis (Satan). He was one of the jinns; he disobeyed the Command of his Lord. Will you then take him (Iblis) and his offspring as protectors and helpers rather than Me while they are enemies to you? What an evil is the exchange for the Zalimun (polytheists, and wrong-doers, etc).

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: We said to the angels, “Bow down to Adam.” So they bowed down, except for Satan. He was of the jinn, and he defied the command of his Lord. Will you take him and his offspring as lords instead of Me, when they are an enemy to you? Evil is the exchange for the wrongdoers.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: And recall when We said to the angels: "Prostrate yourselves before Adam"; all of them fell prostrate, except Iblis. He was of the jinn and so disobeyed the command of his Lord. Will you, then, take him and his progeny as your guardians rather than Me although they are your open enemies? What an evil substitute are these wrong-doers taking!

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: And (remember) when We said to the angels: "Prostrate yourselves unto Adam." So they prostrated themselves, except Iblis. He was one of the Jinn; he disobeyed the command of his Lord. Will you then take him and his offspring as protectors and helpers rather than Me while they are enemies to you What an evil is the exchange for the wrongdoers.

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: And (remember) when We said unto the angels: Fall prostrate before Adam, and they fell prostrate, all save Iblis. He was of the jinn, so he rebelled against his Lord's command. Will ye choose him and his seed for your protecting friends instead of Me, when they are an enemy unto you? Calamitous is the exchange for evil-doers.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: When We said to the angels, ‘Prostrate before Adam,’ they prostrated, but not Iblis. He was one of the jinn, so he transgressed against his Lord’s command. Will you then take him and his offspring for guardians in My stead, though they are your enemies? How evil a substitute for the wrongdoers!

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: When We said to the angels: 'Prostrate yourselves before Adam' all prostrated themselves except iblis, who was one of the jinn, disobedient to the command of his Lord. Would you then take him and his descendants to be your guardians, other than Me, when they are your clear enemy? How evil is the exchange for the harmdoers!

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And [mention] when We said to the angels, "Prostrate to Adam," and they prostrated, except for Iblees. He was of the jinn and departed from the command of his Lord. Then will you take him and his descendants as allies other than Me while they are enemies to you? Wretched it is for the wrongdoers as an exchange.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: When We told the angels to prostrate before Adam they all obeyed except Iblis. He was a jinn and he sinned against the command of his Lord. Why do you (people) obey him and his offspring instead of Me, even though they are your enemies? How terrible will be the recompense that the wrong doers will receive!

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: And when We said to the angels: Make obeisance to Adam; they made obeisance but Iblis (did it not). He was of the jinn, so he transgressed the commandment of his Lord. What! would you then take him and his offspring for friends rather than Me, and they are your enemies? Evil is (this) change for the unjust.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: When We said to the angels, "Prostrate yourselves before Adam," all prostrated themselves except Satan. He was one of the jinn and he disobeyed his Lord's command. Do you then take him and his offspring as protectors instead of Me, despite their enmity towards you? This is an evil exchange for the wrongdoers!

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: Behold! We said to the angels, "Bow down to Adam": They bowed down except Iblis. He was one of the Jinns, and he broke the Command of his Lord. Will ye then take him and his progeny as protectors rather than Me? And they are enemies to you! Evil would be the exchange for the wrong-doers!

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: We had commanded Adam before, but he disregarded it: We found him lacking in resolution.

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: And indeed before this We made a covenant with Adam, so he forgot, and We did not find its intention (in him).

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: And We made covenant with Adam before, but he forgot, and We found in him no constancy.

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: And assuredly We covenanted with Adam aforetime, then he forgat, and We found not in him steadiness.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: And indeed We made a covenant with Adam before, but he forgot, and We found on his part no firm will-power.

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: And We covenanted with Adam before, but he forgot, and We found in him no resolve.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Most certainly We had given Adam a command before, but he forgot. We found him lacking in firmness of resolution.

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: And indeed We made a covenant with Adam before, but he forgot, and We found on his part no firm willpower.

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: And verily We made a covenant of old with Adam, but he forgot, and We found no constancy in him.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: Certainly We had enjoined Adam earlier; but he forgot, and We did not find any resoluteness in him.

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: We made a covenant with Adam, but he forgot and We found in him no constancy.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And We had already taken a promise from Adam before, but he forgot; and We found not in him determination.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: We had commanded Adam (certain matters). He forgot Our commandment and We did not find in him the determination to fulfil Our commandments.

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: And certainly We gave a commandment to Adam before, but he forgot; and We did not find in him any determination.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: We made a covenant with Adam before you, but he forgot, and We found him lacking in constancy.

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: We had already, beforehand, taken the covenant of Adam, but he forgot: and We found on his part no firm resolve.

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: When We said to the angels: ''Bow before Adam,'' they all bowed but Iblis, who refused.

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: And when We commanded the angels, “Prostrate before Adam” – so they all prostrated, except Iblis; he refused.

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: And when We said to the angels, 'Bow yourselves to Adam'; so they bowed themselves, save Iblis; he refused.

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: And recall what time We said to the angels: prostrate yourselves before Adam. They fell prostrate, but Iblis did not; he refused.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: And (remember) when We said to the angels: "Prostrate yourselves to Adam." They prostrated (all) except Iblis (Satan), who refused.

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: And when We said to the angels, “Bow down to Adam.” They bowed down, except for Satan; he refused.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Recall when We said to the angels: "Prostrate yourselves before Adam"; all prostrated themselves save Iblis. He refused.

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: And (remember) when We said to the angels: "Prostrate yourselves to Adam." They prostrated themselves (all) except Iblis; he refused.

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: And when We said unto the angels: Fall prostrate before Adam, they fell prostrate (all) save Iblis; he refused.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: When We said to the angels, ‘Prostrate before Adam,’ they prostrated, but not Iblis: he refused.

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: And when We said to the angels: 'Prostrate yourselves before Adam' they all prostrated themselves except iblis, who refused.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And [mention] when We said to the angels, "Prostrate to Adam," and they prostrated, except Iblees; he refused.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: When We told the angels to prostrate before Adam they all obeyed except Iblis (satan) who refused.

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: And when We said to the angels: Make obeisance to Adam, they made obeisance, but Iblis (did it not); he refused.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: When We said to the angels, "Prostrate yourselves before Adam," they all prostrated themselves, except for Satan, who refused,

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: When We said to the angels, "Prostrate yourselves to Adam", they prostrated themselves, but not Iblis: he refused.

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: So We said; "O Adam, he is truly your enemy and your wife's. Do not let him have you turned out of Paradise and come to grief.

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: We therefore said, “O Adam, he is your and your wife’s enemy, so may he not get you both out from heaven, so you then fall into hardship.”

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: Then We said, 'Adam, surely this is an enemy to thee and thy wife. So let him not expel you both from the Garden, so that thou art unprosperous.

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: Then We said: Adam! verily this is an enemy unto thee and thine spouse; so let him not drive forth you twain from the Garden, lest thou be destressed.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: Then We said: "O Adam! Verily, this is an enemy to you and to your wife. So let him not get you both out of Paradise, so that you be distressed in misery.

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: We said, “O Adam, this is an enemy to you and to your wife. So do not let him make you leave the Garden, for then you will suffer.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Then We said: "Adam! He is an enemy to you and to your wife. So let him not drive both of you out of Paradise and plunge you into affliction,

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: Then We said: "O Adam! Verily, this is an enemy to you and to your wife. So let him not get you both out of Paradise, so that you will be distressed."

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: Therefor we said: O Adam! This is an enemy unto thee and unto thy wife, so let him not drive you both out of the Garden so that thou come to toil.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: We said, ‘O Adam! This is indeed an enemy of yours and your mate’s. So do not let him expel you from paradise, or you will be miserable.

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: 'Adam' We said, 'This is you and your wife's enemy. Do not let him expel you from the Garden, so that you (Adam) will be tired.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: So We said, "O Adam, indeed this is an enemy to you and to your wife. Then let him not remove you from Paradise so you would suffer.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: We said, "Adam, this (satan) is your enemy and the enemy of your spouse. Let him not expel you and your spouse from Paradise lest you plunge into misery.

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: So We said: O Adam! This is an enemy to you and to your wife; therefore let him not drive you both forth from the garden so that you should be unhappy;

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: We said, "Adam, [Satan] is an enemy to you and to your wife. Let him not turn you both out of Paradise and thus make you come to grief.

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: Then We said: "O Adam! verily, this is an enemy to thee and thy wife: so let him not get you both out of the Garden, so that thou art landed in misery.

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: But then Satan tempted him by saying: "O Adam, should I show you the tree of immortality, and a kingdom that will never know any wane?"

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: So the devil incited him, saying, “O Adam, shall I show you the tree of immortality and a kingdom that does not erode?”

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: Then Satan whispered to him saying, 'Adam, shall I point thee to the Tree of Eternity, and a Kingdom that decays not?'

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: Then the Satan whispered unto him; he said: Adam! shall direct thee to the tree of eternity and a dominion that ageth not!

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: Then Shaitan (Satan) whispered to him, saying: "O Adam! Shall I lead you to the Tree of Eternity and to a kingdom that will never waste away?"

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: But Satan whispered to him. He said, “O Adam, shall I show you the Tree of Immortality, and a kingdom that never decays?”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: But Satan seduced him, saying: "Adam! Shall I direct you to a tree of eternal life and an abiding kingdom?"

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: Then Shaytan whispered to him, saying: "O Adam! Shall I lead you to the Tree of Eternity and to a kingdom that will never waste away"

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: But the devil whispered to him, saying: O Adam! Shall I show thee the tree of immortality and power that wasteth not away?

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: Then Satan tempted him. He said, ‘O Adam! Shall I show you the tree of immortality, and an imperishable kingdom?’

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: But satan whispered to him saying: 'Adam, shall I direct you the Tree of Eternity and a kingdom which never decays'

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: Then Satan whispered to him; he said, "O Adam, shall I direct you to the tree of eternity and possession that will not deteriorate?"

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: Satan, trying to seduce him, said, "Adam, do you want me to show you the Tree of Eternity and the Everlasting Kingdom?"

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: But the Shaitan made an evil suggestion to him; he said: O Adam! Shall I guide you to the tree of immortality and a kingdom which decays not?

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: But Satan whispered evil to him, saying, "Adam, shall I lead you to the tree of immortality and to a kingdom that never declines?"

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: But Satan whispered evil to him: he said, "O Adam! shall I lead thee to the Tree of Eternity and to a kingdom that never decays?"

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: And both ate of (its fruit), and their hidden parts were exposed to one another, and they patched the leaves of the garden (to hide them). Adam disobeyed his Lord, and went astray.

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: So they both ate from it – thereupon their shame became manifest to them, and they started applying on themselves the leaves of heaven; and Adam lapsed in obeying his Lord, so did not reach his goal. (Of achieving immortality)

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: So the two of them ate of it, and their shameful parts revealed to them, and they took to stitching upon themselves leaves of the Garden. And Adam disobeyed his Lord, and so he erred.

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: Then the twain ate thereof; so there became disclosed to them their shame, and they began sewing upon them selves some of the leaves of the Garden, so Adam disobeyed his Lord, and erred,

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: Then they both ate of the tree, and so their private parts appeared to them, and they began to stick on themselves the leaves from Paradise for their covering. Thus did Adam disobey his Lord, so he went astray.

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: And so they ate from it; whereupon their bodies became visible to them, and they started covering themselves with the leaves of the Garden. Thus Adam disobeyed his Lord, and fell.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Then the two of them ate the fruit of that tree and their shameful parts became revealed to each other, and they began to cover themselves with the leaves from the Garden. Thus Adam disobeyed his Lord and strayed into error.

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: Then they both ate of the Tree, and so their private parts became manifest to them, and they began to cover themselves with the leaves of the Paradise for their covering. Thus Adam disobeyd his Lord, so he went astray.

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: Then they twain ate thereof, so that their shame became apparent unto them, and they began to hide by heaping on themselves some of the leaves of the Garden. And Adam disobeyed his Lord, so went astray.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: So they both ate of it, and their nakedness became evident to them, and they began to stitch over themselves with the leaves of paradise. Adam disobeyed his Lord, and went amiss.

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: They both ate of it, and their shameful parts appeared to them, whereupon they began to stitch upon themselves leaves from the Garden. And so it was, Adam erred and disobeyed his Lord.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And Adam and his wife ate of it, and their private parts became apparent to them, and they began to fasten over themselves from the leaves of Paradise. And Adam disobeyed his Lord and erred.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: Adam and his wife ate (fruits) from the tree and found themselves naked. Then they started to cover themselves with the leaves from the garden. Adam disobeyed his Lord and went astray.

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: Then they both ate of it, so their evil inclinations became manifest to them, and they both began to cover themselves with leaves of the garden, and Adam disobeyed his Lord, so his life became evil (to him).

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: They both ate the fruit of this tree, and so they became conscious of their nakedness and began to cover themselves with the leaves of the Garden. Thus Adam disobeyed his Lord and fell into error.

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: In the result, they both ate of the tree, and so their nakedness appeared to them: they began to sew together, for their covering, leaves from the Garden: thus did Adam disobey his Lord, and allow himself to be seduced.

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: Then He gave Adam knowledge of the nature and reality of all things and everything, and set them before the angels and said: "Tell Me the names of these if you are truthful."

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: And Allah the Supreme taught Adam all the names (of things), then presented them to the angels, saying, “Tell Me the names of these, if you are truthful.”

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: And He taught Adam the names, all of them; then He presented them unto the angels and said, 'Now tell Me the names of these, if you speak truly.'

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: And He taught Adam the names, all of them; thereafter He set them before the angles, and said declare unto Me the names of those if ye say sooth.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: And He taught Adam all the names (of everything), then He showed them to the angels and said, "Tell Me the names of these if you are truthful."

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: And He taught Adam the names, all of them; then he presented them to the angels, and said, “Tell Me the names of these, if you are sincere.”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Allah replied, "I know what you do not know." After this he taught Adam the names of all things. Then He set these before the angels and asked, "Tell Me the names of these things, if you are right (in thinking that the appointment of a vicegerent will cause disorder)".

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: And He taught Adam all the names (of everything), then He showed them to the angels and said, "Tell Me the names of these if you are truthful."

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: And He taught Adam all the names, then showed them to the angels, saying: Inform Me of the names of these, if ye are truthful.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: And He taught Adam the Names, all of them; then presented them to the angels and said, ‘Tell me the names of these, if you are truthful.’

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: He taught Adam (father of humans) the names all of them and then presented them to the angels, saying: 'Tell Me the names of these, if you are truthful'

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And He taught Adam the names - all of them. Then He showed them to the angels and said, "Inform Me of the names of these, if you are truthful."

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: He taught Adam all the names. Then He introduced (some intelligent beings) to the angels, asking them to tell Him the names of these beings, if the angels were true to their claim (that they more deserved to be His deputies on earth).

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: And He taught Adam all the names, then presented them to the angels; then He said: Tell me the names of those if you are right.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: He taught Adam all the names, then He set them before the angels and said, "Tell Me the names of these, if what you say be true."

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: And He taught Adam the names of all things; then He placed them before the angels, and said: "Tell me the names of these if ye are right."

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: Then He said to Adam: "Convey to them their names." And when he had told them, God said: "Did I not tell you that I know the unknown of the heavens and the earth, and I know what you disclose and know what you hide?"

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: He said “O Adam! Inform them the names”; and when Adam had informed them their names, He said, “Did I not tell you that I know all the secrets of the heavens and the earth? And I know all what you disclose and all what you hide?”

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: He said, 'Adam, tell them their names.' And when he had told them their names He said, 'Did I not tell you I know the unseen things of the heavens and earth? And I know what things you reveal, and what you were hiding.'

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: Allah said: O Adam! declare thou unto them the names of those objects. Then when he had declared unto them the names of those, He said: said I not unto you, verily I know the hidden in the heavens and the earth, and know that which ye disclose and that which ye are wont to conceal!

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: He said: "O Adam! Inform them of their names," and when he had informed them of their names, He said: "Did I not tell you that I know the Ghaib (unseen) in the heavens and the earth, and I know what you reveal and what you have been concealing?"

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: He said, “O Adam, tell them their names.” And when he told them their names, He said, “Did I not tell you that I know the secrets of the heavens and the earth, and that I know what you reveal and what you conceal?”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Then Allah said to Adam, "Tell them the names of these things." When Adam told them the names of all those things, Allah declared, "Did I not tell you that I know those truths about the Earth and the Heavens which are hidden from you? I know what you disclose and what you hide."

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: He said: "O Adam! Inform them of their names," and when he had informed them of their names, He said: "Did I not tell you that I know the Ghayb (unseen) in the heavens and the earth, and I know what you reveal and what you have been concealing"

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: He said: O Adam! Inform them of their names, and when he had informed them of their names, He said: Did I not tell you that I know the secret of the heavens and the earth? And I know that which ye disclose and which ye hide.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: He said, ‘O Adam, inform them of their names,’ and when he had informed them of their names, He said, ‘Did I not tell you that I know the Unseen of the heavens and the earth, and that I know whatever you disclose and whatever you conceal?’

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: Then He said to Adam: 'Tell them their names.' And when Adam had named them, He said: 'Did I not tell you that I know the unseen of the heavens and earth, and all that you reveal and all that you hide'

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: He said, "O Adam, inform them of their names." And when he had informed them of their names, He said, "Did I not tell you that I know the unseen [aspects] of the heavens and the earth? And I know what you reveal and what you have concealed."

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: The Lord said to Adam, "Tell the names of the beings to the angels." When Adam said their names, the Lord said, "Did I not tell you (angels) that I know the secrets of the heavens and the earth and all that you reveal or hide?"

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: He said: O Adam! inform them of their names. Then when he had informed them of their names, He said: Did I not say to you that I surely know what is ghaib in the heavens and the earth and (that) I know what you manifest and what you hide?

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: Then He said, "O Adam, tell them their names." When Adam had told them the names, God said to the angels, "Did I not say to you: I know the secrets of the heavens and of the earth, and I know what you reveal and what you conceal?"

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: He said: "O Adam! Tell them their names." When he had told them, Allah said: "Did I not tell you that I know the secrets of heaven and earth, and I know what ye reveal and what ye conceal?"

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: Remember, when We asked the angels to bow in homage to Adam, they all bowed but Iblis, who disdained and turned insolent, and so became a disbeliever.

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: And (remember) when We ordered the angels to prostrate before Adam, so they all prostrated, except Iblis (Satan – devil); he refused and was proud – and became a disbeliever.

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: And when We said to the angels, 'Bow yourselves to Adam'; so they bowed themselves, save Iblis; he refused, and waxed proud, and so he became one of the unbelievers.

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: And recall what time We said unto the angels: prostrate yourselves before Adam, they prostrated themselves; but not Iblis he refused and was stiff - necked and became of the infidels.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: And (remember) when We said to the angels: "Prostrate yourselves before Adam.". And they prostrated except Iblis (Satan), he refused and was proud and was one of the disbelievers (disobedient to Allah).

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: And We said to the angels, “Bow down to Adam.” They bowed down, except for Satan. He refused, was arrogant, and was one of the disbelievers.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Then We commanded the angels, "Bow yourselves to Adam. "All bowed but Iblis refused to do so; he waxed proud and joined the defiers.

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: And (remember) when We said to the angels: "Prostrate yourselves before Adam." And they prostrated except Iblis (Shaytan), he refused and was proud and was one of the disbelievers (disobedient to Allah).

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: And when We said unto the angels: Prostrate yourselves before Adam, they fell prostrate, all save Iblis. He demurred through pride, and so became a disbeliever.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: And when We said to the angels, ‘Prostrate before Adam,’ they prostrated, but not Iblis: he refused and acted arrogantly, and he was one of the faithless.

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: And when We said to the angels: 'Prostrate (to Me) yourselves towards Adam,' they all prostrated themselves except iblis (satan, father of the jinn), who, in his pride refused and became an unbeliever.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And [mention] when We said to the angels, "Prostrate before Adam"; so they prostrated, except for Iblees. He refused and was arrogant and became of the disbelievers.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: When We told the angels to prostrate before Adam, they all obeyed except Iblis (Satan) who abstained out of pride and so he became one of those who deny the truth.

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: And when We said to the angels: Make obeisance to Adam they did obeisance, but Iblis (did it not). He refused and he was proud, and he was one of the unbelievers.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: When We said to the angels, "Bow down before Adam," they all bowed except for Iblis [Satan]. He refused and acted proudly and became an unbeliever.

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: And behold, We said to the angels: "Bow down to Adam" and they bowed down. Not so Iblis: he refused and was haughty: He was of those who reject Faith.

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: And We said to Adam: "Both you and your spouse live in the Garden, eat freely to your fill wherever you like, but approach not this tree or you will become transgressors.

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: And We said, “O Adam! You and your wife dwell in this Garden, and eat freely from it wherever you please – but do not approach this tree for you will become of those who transgress.”

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: And We said, 'Adam, dwell thou, and thy wife, in the Garden, and eat thereof easefully where you desire; but draw not nigh this tree, lest you be evildoers.'

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: And We said: Adam! dwell thou and thine spouse in the Garden, and eat ye twain plenteously thereof as ye list, but approach not yonder tree, lest yet twain become of the wrong-doers.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: And We said: "O Adam! Dwell you and your wife in the Paradise and eat both of you freely with pleasure and delight of things therein as wherever you will, but come not near this tree or you both will be of the Zalimun (wrong-doers)."

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: We said, “O Adam, inhabit the Garden, you and your spouse, and eat from it freely as you please, but do not approach this tree, lest you become wrongdoers.”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Then We said, "O Adam, you and your wife, both dwell in the Garden and eat to your hearts' content where from you will, but do not go near this tree; otherwise you shall become transgressors"

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: And We said: "O Adam! Dwell you and your wife in the Paradise and eat both of you freely with pleasure and delight, of things therein wherever you will, but come not near this tree or you both will be of the Zalimin (wrongdoers). "

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: And We said: O Adam! Dwell thou and thy wife in the Garden, and eat ye freely (of the fruits) thereof where ye will; but come not nigh this tree lest ye become wrong-doers.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: We said, ‘O Adam, dwell with your mate in paradise and eat thereof freely whencesoever you wish, but do not approach this tree, lest you should be among the wrongdoers.’

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: To Adam We said: 'Dwell with your wife in Paradise and both eat of it as much as you wish and wherever you will. But neither of you should come close to this tree or else you shall both become transgressors'

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And We said, "O Adam, dwell, you and your wife, in Paradise and eat therefrom in [ease and] abundance from wherever you will. But do not approach this tree, lest you be among the wrongdoers."

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: We told Adam to stay with his spouse (Eve) in the garden and enjoy the foods therein, but not to go near a certain tree lest he become one of the transgressors.

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: And We said: O Adam! Dwell you and your wife in the garden and eat from it a plenteous (food) wherever you wish and do not approach this tree, for then you will be of the unjust.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: We said, "O Adam! live with your wife in Paradise and eat freely from it anywhere you may wish. Yet do not approach this tree lest you become wrongdoers."

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: We said: "O Adam! dwell thou and thy wife in the Garden; and eat of the bountiful things therein as (where and when) ye will; but approach not this tree, or ye run into harm and transgression."

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: Then his Lord sent commands to Adam and turned towards him: Indeed He is compassionate and kind.

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: Then Adam learnt from his Lord certain words (of revelation), therefore Allah accepted his repentance; indeed He only is the Most Acceptor of Repentance, the Most Merciful. (See Verse 7:23)

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: Thereafter Adam received certain words from his Lord, and He turned towards him; truly He turns, and is All-compassionate.

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: Then Adam learnt from his Lord certain Words, and He relented toward him, verily He! He is the Relentant, the Merciful.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: Then Adam received from his Lord Words. And his Lord pardoned him (accepted his repentance). Verily, He is the One Who forgives (accepts repentance), the Most Merciful.

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: Then Adam received words from his Lord, so He relented towards him. He is the Relenting, the Merciful.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: At that time Adam learnt appropriate words from his Lord and repented, and his Lord accepted his repentance, for He is very Relenting and very Merciful.

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: Then Adam received from his Lord Words. And his Lord pardoned him (accepted his repentance). Verily, He is the One Who forgives (accepts repentance), the Most Merciful.

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: Then Adam received from his Lord words (of revelation), and He relented toward him. Lo! He is the relenting, the Merciful.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: Then Adam received certain words from his Lord, and He turned to him clemently. Indeed He is the All-clement, the All-merciful.

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: Then Adam received Words from his Lord, and his Lord relented towards him. He is the Receiver of Repentance, the Merciful.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: Then Adam received from his Lord [some] words, and He accepted his repentance. Indeed, it is He who is the Accepting of repentance, the Merciful.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: Adam was inspired by some words (of prayer) through which he received forgiveness from his Lord, for He is All-forgiving and All-merciful.

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: Then Adam received (some) words from his Lord, so He turned to him mercifully; surely He is Oft-returning (to mercy), the Merciful.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: Then Adam received some words [of prayer] from his Lord and He accepted his repentance. He is the Forgiving One, the Merciful.

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: Then learnt Adam from his Lord words of inspiration, and his Lord Turned towards him; for He is Oft-Returning, Most Merciful.

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: Did I not commit you, O children of Adam, not to worship Satan who is your acknowledged foe,

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: “O Descendants of Adam! Did I not take a covenant from you that you shall not worship the devil? Undoubtedly, he is your open enemy.”

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: Made I not covenant with you, Children of Adam, that you should not serve Satan -- surely he is a manifest foe to you --

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: Enjoined I not on you, ye children of Adam, that ye shall not worship the Satan - verily he is Unto you manifest foe.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: Did I not ordain for you, O Children of Adam, that you should not worship Shaitan (Satan). Verily, he is a plain enemy to you.

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: Did I not covenant with you, O Children of Adam, that you shall not serve the devil? That he is your sworn enemy?

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Children of Adam, did I not command you not to serve Satan -- he is to you an open enemy

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: "Did I not command you, O Children of Adam, that you should not worship Shaytan Verily, he is a plain enemy to you."

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: Did I not charge you, O ye sons of Adam, that ye worship not the devil - Lo! he is your open foe! -

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: ‘Did I not exhort you, O children of Adam, saying, “Do not worship Satan. He is indeed your manifest enemy.

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: Children of Adam, did I not make a covenant with you, that you should not worship satan he is surely a clear enemy to you

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: Did I not enjoin upon you, O children of Adam, that you not worship Satan - [for] indeed, he is to you a clear enemy -

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: Children of Adam, did We not command you not to worship satan. He was your sworn enemy.

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: Did I not charge you, O children of Adam! that you should not serve the Shaitan? Surely he is your open enemy,

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: Did I not enjoin you, sons of Adam, not to worship Satan -- for he is your sworn enemy,

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: "Did I not enjoin on you, O ye Children of Adam, that ye should not worship Satan; for that he was to you an enemy avowed?-

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: God had chosen Adam and Noah and the families of Abraham and 'Imran in preference to others.

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: Indeed Allah chose Adam, and Nooh, and the Family of Ibrahim, and the Family of Imran over the creation.

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: God chose Adam and Noah and the House of Abraham and the House of Imran above all beings, the

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: Verily did Allah choose Adam and Nuh and the house of lbrahim and the house of 'lmran out of the worlds

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: Allah chose Adam, Nuh (Noah), the family of Ibrahim (Abraham) and the family of 'Imran above the 'Alamin (mankind and jinns) (of their times).

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: God chose Adam, and Noah, and the family of Abraham, and the family of Imran, over all mankind.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Truly Allah chose Adam and Noah and the descendants of Abraham and of 'Imran above all mankind.

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: Allah chose Adam, Nuh (Noah), the family of Ibrahim and the family of `Imran above the nations.

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: Lo! Allah preferred Adam and Noah and the Family of Abraham and the Family of 'Imran above (all His) creatures.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: Indeed Allah chose Adam and Noah, and the progeny of Abraham and the progeny of Imran above all the nations;

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: Allah chose Adam and Noah, the House of Abraham and the House of Imran above all worlds.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: Indeed, Allah chose Adam and Noah and the family of Abraham and the family of 'Imran over the worlds -

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: God chose (and gave distinction to) Adam, Noah, the family of Abraham, and Imran over all the people of the world.

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: Surely Allah chose Adam and Nuh and the descendants of Ibrahim and the descendants of Imran above the nations.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: God chose Adam and Noah and the family of Abraham and the family of 'Imran above all His creatures.

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: Allah did choose Adam and Noah, the family of Abraham, and the family of 'Imran above all people,-

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: Verily We created you and gave you form and shape, and ordered the angels to bow before Adam in homage; and they all bowed but Iblis who was not among those who bowed.

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: And indeed We created you, then designed you and then ordered the angels, “Prostrate before Adam”; so they all prostrated, except Iblis (Satan); he did not become of those who prostrate.

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: We created you, then We shaped you, then We said to the angels: 'Bow yourselves to Adam'; so they bowed themselves, save Iblis -- he was not of those that bowed themselves.

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: And assuredly We created you, thereafter We fashioned you, and thereafter We said to the angels: prostrate yourselves before Adam; then they fell prostrate; not so Iblis: he was not of those who fell prostrate.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: And surely, We created you (your father Adam) and then gave you shape (the noble shape of a human being), then We told the angels, "Prostrate to Adam", and they prostrated, except Iblis (Satan), he refused to be of those who prostrate.

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: We created you, then We shaped you, then We said to the angels, “Bow down before Adam;” so they bowed down, except for Satan; he was not of those who bowed down.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: We initiated your creation, then We gave you each a shape, and then We said to the angels: 'Prostrate before Adam.') They all prostrated except Iblis: he was not one of those who fell Prostrate.

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: And surely, We created you and then gave you shape; then We told the angels, "Prostrate yourselves to Adam," and they prostrated, except Iblis (Shaytan), he refused to be of those who prostrated.

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: And We created you, then fashioned you, then told the angels: Fall ye prostrate before Adam! And they fell prostrate, all save Iblis, who was not of those who make prostration.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: Certainly We created you, then We formed you, then We said to the angels, ‘Prostrate before Adam.’ So they [all] prostrated, but not Iblis: he was not among those who prostrated.

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: We created you then We shaped you, then We said to the angels: 'Prostrate yourselves before Adam' They all prostrated themselves except iblis he was not among the prostrated.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And We have certainly created you, [O Mankind], and given you [human] form. Then We said to the angels, "Prostrate to Adam"; so they prostrated, except for Iblees. He was not of those who prostrated.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: We created and shaped you, then told the angels to prostrate themselves before Adam. All the angels obeyed except Satan who did not.

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: And certainly We created you, then We fashioned you, then We said to the angels: Prostrate to Adam. So they did prostrate except Iblis; he was not of those who prostrated.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: We created you, then We shaped you and then We said to the angels, "Prostrate yourselves before Adam," and they all prostrated themselves, except Satan. He was not among those who prostrated themselves.

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: It is We Who created you and gave you shape; then We bade the angels prostrate to Adam, and they prostrate; not so Iblis; He refused to be of those who prostrate.

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: And you, O Adam, and your spouse, live in the Garden and eat your fill wheresoever you like, but do not approach this tree, or you will become iniquitous."

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: And said, “O Adam! You and your wife dwell in Paradise – therefore eat from it from wherever you wish, and do not approach this tree for you will become of those who transgress.”

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: 'O Adam, inherit, thou and thy wife, the Garden, and eat of where you will, but come not nigh this tree, lest you be of the evildoers.'

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: And: O Adam: dwell thou and thy spouse in the Garden and eat ye twain thereof Whence ye will, and approach not yonder tree lest ye twain become of the wrong-doers.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: "And O Adam! Dwell you and your wife in Paradise, and eat thereof as you both wish, but approach not this tree otherwise you both will be of the Zalimun (unjust and wrong-doers)."

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: And you, Adam, inhabit the Garden, you and your wife, and eat whatever you wish; but do not approach this tree, lest you become sinners.”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: O Adam! Live you and your spouse in the Garden and both of you eat from it wherever you will, but never approach the tree or you shall become wrongdoers.'

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: "And O Adam! Dwell you and your wife in Paradise, and eat thereof as you both wish, but approach not this tree otherwise you both will be of the wrongdoers.

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: And (unto man): O Adam! Dwell thou and thy wife in the Garden and eat from whence ye will, but come not nigh this tree lest ye become wrong-doers.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: [Then He said to Adam,] ‘O Adam, dwell with your mate in paradise, and eat thereof whence you wish; but do not approach this tree, lest you should be among the wrongdoers.’

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: 'O Adam dwell with your wife in Paradise, and eat from whatever you please; but never approach this tree or you shall both become harmdoers'

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And "O Adam, dwell, you and your wife, in Paradise and eat from wherever you will but do not approach this tree, lest you be among the wrongdoers."

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: Then the Lord said, "Adam, stay in the garden with your spouse and eat whatever you want therein, but do not go near this tree lest you transgress".

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: And (We said): O Adam! Dwell you and your wife in the garden; so eat from where you desire, but do not go near this tree, for then you will be of the unjust.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: To Adam He said, "You and your wife, dwell in the Garden and eat and drink there from wherever you wish, but do not approach this tree, lest you become wrongdoers."

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: "O Adam! dwell thou and thy wife in the Garden, and enjoy (its good things) as ye wish: but approach not this tree, or ye run into harm and transgression."

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: O sons of Adam, We have revealed to you a dress that would both hide your nakedness and be an adornment, but the raiment of piety is best. This is one of the tokens of God: You may haply reflect.

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: O Descendants of Adam! We have sent down to you a garment to conceal your shame, and another garment for your elegance; and the garment of piety – that is the best; this is among the signs of Allah, so that they may remember.

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: Children of Adam! We have sent down on you a garment to cover your shameful parts, and feathers; and the garment of godfearing -- that is better; that is one of God's signs; haply they will remember.

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: O Children of Adam! verily We have sent down unto you a garment covering your shame and as an adornment; and the garment of piety --that is the best. That is of the signss of Allah, that haply they may be admonished.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: O Children of Adam! We have bestowed raiment upon you to cover yourselves (screen your private parts, etc.) and as an adornment, and the raiment of righteousness, that is better. Such are among the Ayat (proofs, evidences, verses, lessons, signs, revelations, etc.) of Allah, that they may remember (i.e. leave falsehood and follow truth).

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: O children of Adam! We have provided you with clothing to cover your bodies, and for luxury. But the clothing of piety—that is best. These are some of God’s revelations, so that they may take heed.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: O Children of Adam! Indeed We have sent down to you a garment which covers your shame and provides protection and adornment. But the finest of all is the garment of piety. That is one of the signs of Allah so that they may take heed.

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: O Children of Adam! We have bestowed Libas (raiment) upon you to cover yourselves with, and as Rish (adornment); and the Libas (raiment) of Taqwa, that is better. Such are among the Ayat of Allah, that they may remember.

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: O Children of Adam! We have revealed unto you raiment to conceal your shame, and splendid vesture, but the raiment of restraint from evil, that is best. This is of the revelations of Allah, that they may remember.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: ‘O Children of Adam! We have certainly sent down to you garments to cover your nakedness, and for adornment. Yet the garment of Godwariness—that is the best.’ That is [one] of Allah’s signs, so that they may take admonition.

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: Children of Adam! We have sent down to you clothing that covers your nakedness, and feathers. But the clothing of piety that is better. That is one of the signs of Allah, in order that they remember.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: O children of Adam, We have bestowed upon you clothing to conceal your private parts and as adornment. But the clothing of righteousness - that is best. That is from the signs of Allah that perhaps they will remember.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: Children of Adam, We have given you clothing to cover your private parts and for beauty, but the robe of piety is the best. Thus is the guidance of God so that you may take heed.

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: O children of Adam! We have indeed sent down to you clothing to cover your shame, and (clothing) for beauty and clothing that guards (against evil), that is the best. This is of the communications of Allah that they may be mindful.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: O children of Adam! We have sent down to you clothes to cover your nakedness, and to be pleasing to the eye; but the raiment of righteousness is the best. That is one of the signs of God. So that people may take heed.

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: O ye Children of Adam! We have bestowed raiment upon you to cover your shame, as well as to be an adornment to you. But the raiment of righteousness,- that is the best. Such are among the Signs of Allah, that they may receive admonition!

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: O sons of Adam, let not Satan beguile you as he did your parents out of Eden, and made them disrobe to expose their disgrace to them. For he and his host can see you from where you cannot see them. We have made the devils the friends of those who do not believe,

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: O Descendants of Adam, beware! Do not let Satan put you in trial the way he removed your parents from Paradise and had their garments removed so that their shame become visible to them; indeed he and his tribe see you from where you do not see them; indeed We have made the devils the friends of those who do not believe.

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: Children of Adam! Let not Satan tempt you as he brought your parents out of the Garden, stripping them of their garments to show them their shameful parts. Surely he sees you, he and his tribe, from where you see them not. We have made the Satans the friends of those who do not believe.

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: O Children of Adam! let not the Satan tempt you even as he drave forth your parents from the Garden, divesting the twain of their garment that he might discover unto the twain their shame. Verily he beholdeth you, he and his tribe, in such wise that ye behold them not. Verily We have made the Satans patrons of those only who believe not.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: O Children of Adam! Let not Shaitan (Satan) deceive you, as he got your parents [Adam and Hawwa (Eve)] out of Paradise, stripping them of their raiments, to show them their private parts. Verily, he and Qabiluhu (his soldiers from the jinns or his tribe) see you from where you cannot see them. Verily, We made the Shayatin (devils) Auliya' (protectors and helpers) for those who believe not.

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: O Children of Adam! Do not let Satan seduce you, as he drove your parents out of the Garden, stripping them of their garments, to show them their nakedness. He sees you, him and his clan, from where you cannot see them. We have made the devils friends of those who do not believe.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Children of Adam! Let not Satan deceive you in the manner he deceived your parents out of Paradise, pulling off from them their clothing to reveal to them their shame. He and his host surely see you from whence you do not see them. We have made satans the guardians of those who do not believe.

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: O Children of Adam! Let not Shaytan deceive you, as he got your parents out of Paradise, stripping them of their raiment, to show them their private parts. Verily, he and his tribe see you from where you cannot see them. Verily, We made the Shayatin friends of those who believe not.

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: O Children of Adam! Let not Satan seduce you as he caused your (first) parents to go forth from the Garden and tore off from them their robe (of innocence) that he might manifest their shame to them. Lo! he seeth you, he and his tribe, from whence ye see him not. Lo! We have made the devils protecting friends for those who believe not.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: ‘O Children of Adam! Do not let Satan tempt you, like he expelled your parents from paradise, stripping them of their garments to expose to them their nakedness. Indeed he sees you—he and his hosts—whence you do not see them. We have indeed made the devils friends of those who have no faith.’

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: Children of Adam! Do not let satan tempt you, as he brought your parents out of Paradise. He stripped them of their garments to show them their shameful parts. Indeed he and his descendants see you from where you cannot see them. We have made the satans supporters of those who do not believe.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: O children of Adam, let not Satan tempt you as he removed your parents from Paradise, stripping them of their clothing to show them their private parts. Indeed, he sees you, he and his tribe, from where you do not see them. Indeed, We have made the devils allies to those who do not believe.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: Children of Adam, do not let Satan seduce you, as he caused your parents to be expelled from the garden and made them take off their clothes in order to show them their private parts. Satan and those like him see you but you do not see them. We have made the Satans as friends for those who have no faith.

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: O children of Adam! let not the Shaitan cause you to fall into affliction as he expelled your parents from the garden, pulling off from them both their clothing that he might show them their evil inclinations, he surely sees you, he as well as his host, from whence you cannot see them; surely We have made the Shaitans to be the guardians of those who do not believe.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: Children of Adam, do not let Satan seduce you, just as he turned your parents out of the Garden: he deprived them of their garment in order to make them aware of their nakedness. He and his forces watch you from where you do not see them! We have made the devils friends of those who do not believe.

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: O ye Children of Adam! Let not Satan seduce you, in the same manner as He got your parents out of the Garden, stripping them of their raiment, to expose their shame: for he and his tribe watch you from a position where ye cannot see them: We made the evil ones friends (only) to those without faith.

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: O sons of Adam, attire yourselves at every time of worship; eat and drink, but do not be wasteful, for God does not like the prodigals.

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: O Descendants of Adam! Adorn yourself when you go to the mosque, and eat and drink, and do not cross limits; indeed He does not like the transgressors.

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: Children of Adam! Take your adornment at every place of worship; and eat and drink, but be you not prodigal; He loves not the prodigal.

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: O Children of Adam! take your adornment at every worship: and eat and drink, and waste not; verily He approveth not the wasters.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: O Children of Adam! Take your adornment (by wearing your clean clothes), while praying and going round (the Tawaf of) the Ka'bah, and eat and drink but waste not by extravagance, certainly He (Allah) likes not Al-Musrifun (those who waste by extravagance).

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: O Children of Adam! Dress properly at every place of worship, and eat and drink, but do not be excessive. He does not love the excessive.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Children of Adam! Take your adornment at every time of Prayer; and eat and drink without going to excesses. For Allah does not like those who go to excess.

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: O Children of Adam! Take your adornment to every Masjid, and eat and drink, but waste not by extravagance, certainly He (Allah) likes not the wasteful.

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: O Children of Adam! Look to your adornment at every place of worship, and eat and drink, but be not prodigal. Lo! He loveth not the prodigals.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: O Children of Adam! Put on your adornment on every occasion of prayer, and eat and drink, but do not waste; indeed, He does not like the wasteful.

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: Children of Adam, take your adornment at every place of prayer. Eat and drink, and do not waste. He does not love the wasteful.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: O children of Adam, take your adornment at every masjid, and eat and drink, but be not excessive. Indeed, He likes not those who commit excess.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: Children of Adam, dress well when attending the mosques, eat and drink but do not be excessive for God does not love those who are excessive (in what they do).

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: O children of Adam! attend to your embellishments at every time of prayer, and eat and drink and be not extravagant; surely He does not love the extravagant.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: O Children of Adam, dress yourself properly whenever you are at worship: and eat and drink but do not be wasteful: God does not like wasteful people.

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: O Children of Adam! wear your beautiful apparel at every time and place of prayer: eat and drink: But waste not by excess, for Allah loveth not the wasters.

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: O sons of Adam, when apostles come to you from among you, who convey My messages, then those who take heed and amend will have neither fear nor regret.

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: O Descendants of Adam! If Noble Messengers from among you come to you narrating My verses – so whoever practices piety and reforms – upon him shall be no fear nor shall he grieve.

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: Children of Adam! If there should come to you Messengers from among you, relating to you My signs, then whosoever is godfearing and makes amends -- no fear shall be on them, neither shall they sorrow.

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: O Children of Adam! if there come unto you apostles from amongst you recounting My signs unto you, then whosoever shall fear God and amend, on them no fear shall come nor they shall grieve.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: O Children of Adam! If there come to you Messengers from amongst you, reciting to you, My Verses, then whosoever becomes pious and righteous, on them shall be no fear, nor shall they grieve.

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: O Children of Adam! When messengers from among you come to you, relating to you My revelations—whoever practices piety and reforms—upon them shall be no fear, nor shall they grieve.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Children of Adam! If Messengers come to you from amongst yourselves who rehearse to you My signs, then those who shun disobedience and mend their ways shall have nothing to fear, nor shall they grieve.

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: O Children of Adam! If there come to you Messengers from among you, reciting to you My Ayat, then whosoever has Taqwa and becomes righteous, on them shall be no fear nor shall they grieve.

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: O Children of Adam! When messengers of your own come unto you who narrate unto you My revelations, then whosoever refraineth from evil and amendeth - there shall no fear come upon them neither shall they grieve.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: O Children of Adam! If there come to you apostles from among yourselves, recounting to you My signs, then those who are Godwary and righteous will have no fear, nor will they grieve.

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: Children of Adam, when Messengers of your own come to narrate to you My verses, those who are cautious and mend their ways will have nothing to fear neither shall they be saddened,

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: O children of Adam, if there come to you messengers from among you relating to you My verses, then whoever fears Allah and reforms - there will be no fear concerning them, nor will they grieve.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: Children of Adam, when Messengers from among your own people come to you to preach My revelations, those who choose piety and reform themselves will have nothing to fear nor will they be grieved.

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: O children of Adam! if there come to you apostles from among you relating to you My communications, then whoever shall guard (against evil) and act aright-- they shall have no fear nor shall they grieve.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: Children of Adam! If messengers come to you from among yourselves, reciting My revelations to you, then those that take warning and mend their ways, on such shall come no fear nor shall they grieve.

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: O ye Children of Adam! whenever there come to you messengers from amongst you, rehearsing My signs unto you,- those who are righteous and mend (their lives),- on them shall be no fear nor shall they grieve.

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: These are (some of) those who were favoured by God among the prophets of the progeny of Adam, and of those We bore in the ark with Noah, and the offspring of Abraham and Israel, and of those We guided and We chose, for they bowed weeping in adoration when the revelations of Ar-Rahman were recited to them.

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: It is these upon whom Allah has bestowed favour among the Prophets, from the descendants of Adam; and from those whom We boarded along with Nooh; and from the descendants of Ibrahim and Israel; and from those whom We guided and chose; when the verses of the Most Gracious were recited to them, they fell down, prostrating and weeping. (* Command of Prostration # 5.)

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: These are they whom God has blessed among the Prophets of the seed of Adam, and of those We bore with Noah, and of the seed of Abraham and Israel, and of those We guided and chose. When the signs of the All-merciful were recited to them, they fell down prostrate, weeping.

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: These are they whom Allah hath favoured, from among the prophets, of the progeny of Adam and of them whom We bare with Nuh, and of the progeny of Ibrahim and Isra'il, and of those whom We have guided and chosen; whenever the revelations of the Compassionate were rehearsed unto them, they fell down prostrating themselves and weeping. *Chapter: 19

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: Those were they unto whom Allah bestowed His Grace from among the Prophets, of the offspring of Adam, and of those whom We carried (in the ship) with Nuh (Noah), and of the offspring of Ibrahim (Abraham) and Israel and from among those whom We guided and chose. When the Verses of the Most Beneficent (Allah) were recited unto them, they fell down prostrating and weeping.

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: These are some of the prophets God has blessed, from the descendants of Adam, and from those We carried with Noah, and from the descendants of Abraham and Israel, and from those We guided and selected. Whenever the revelations of the Most Gracious are recited to them, they would fall down, prostrating and weeping.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: These are the Prophets upon whom Allah bestowed His favour from the seed of Adam, and from the seed of those whom We carried (in the Ark) with Noah, and from the seed of Abraham and Israel. They were those whom We guided and chose (for an exalted position). They were such that when the words of the Most Compassionate Lord were recited to them, they fell down in prostration, weeping.

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: Those were they unto whom Allah bestowed His grace from among the Prophets, of the offspring of Adam, and of those whom We carried (in the ship) with Nuh, and of the offspring of Ibrahim and Israel, and from among those whom We guided and chose. When the Ayat of the Most Gracious were recited unto them, they fell down prostrate and weeping.

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: These are they unto whom Allah showed favour from among the prophets, of the seed of Adam and of those whom We carried (in the ship) with Noah, and of the seed of Abraham and Israel, and from among those whom We guided and chose. When the revelations of the Beneficent were recited unto them, they fell down, adoring and weeping.

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: These are whom Allah has blessed among the Prophets from among the seed of Adam and of those whom We bore with Noah; the descendants ofAbraham, of Israel, and of those whom We have guided and chose. For when the verses of the Merciful were recited to them, they fell down prostrate, weeping.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: Those were the ones upon whom Allah bestowed favor from among the prophets of the descendants of Adam and of those We carried [in the ship] with Noah, and of the descendants of Abraham and Israel, and of those whom We guided and chose.
